description: In a cutting-edge IoT startup, two lead developers, Alice and Bob, must decide how to allocate a limited supply of crucial hardware components needed for their respective project modules. Alice, responsible for the core processing unit, proposes how to divide these scarce components between her module and Bob's sensor integration system. Bob then chooses to accept the proposed allocation, allowing the project to continue smoothly, or reject it, which causes a delay in the project timeline and reduces the overall device effectiveness, impacting the startup’s market competitiveness.

proposer_behavior_choices.skewed_proposal: Allocate 70% of the hardware components to the core processing unit and 30% to the sensor integration system
proposer_behavior_choices.compromise_proposal: Allocate 60% of the hardware components to the core processing unit and 40% to the sensor integration system
proposer_behavior_choices.equal_split: Divide the hardware components equally, 50% to each module

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Accept the proposed allocation and proceed with development
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the allocation, causing a 5-day project delay and a 15% drop in device performance

additional_context: Alice's role as lead of the core processing unit gives her the authority to propose the division of these highly specialized, limited components. The balance of allocation affects technical performance and market success, requiring strategic consideration from both parties.

description: In a scenario where two oncologists are deciding how to allocate a shared research grant, one oncologist proposes a specific division of the total funds between themselves and the other oncologist. The second oncologist can then either accept or reject this proposed allocation. If the proposal is accepted, the funds are distributed accordingly to support their respective research projects. If rejected, the grant is forfeited and neither oncologist receives any funding.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Propose to allocate sixty percent of the grant funds to themselves and forty percent to the other oncologist
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Propose to allocate fifty percent of the grant funds to each oncologist

responder_behavior_choices.reject: Decline the proposed funding allocation, resulting in no grant funds awarded to either oncologist

natural_language.accept_medium: Alice receives sixty percent of the grant funding, Bob receives forty percent.
natural_language.accept_high: Both Alice and Bob receive equal funding, fifty percent each.
natural_language.reject_any: No funding is awarded to either Alice or Bob.

description: Alice and Bob are campaign strategists working together on a joint media promotion for a new product launch. responder_behavior_choices.accept: Approve the proposed budget distribution and proceed with the campaign.
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the proposal, causing the campaign to be canceled, resulting in lost revenue and reputational harm.

Alice proposes a specific division of these resources, determining how much support each officer’s cases will receive. Bob then decides whether to accept or reject this proposal. If Bob accepts, both officers can proceed promptly, maximizing the positive impact on vulnerable families. If Bob rejects, bureaucratic delays occur, causing a reduction in the effectiveness of interventions and potentially endangering the well-being of the children involved. The time-sensitive nature of the cases creates pressure to reach a mutually agreeable distribution.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Propose allocating 70% of resources to her cases and 30% to Bob's
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Propose allocating 60% of resources to her cases and 40% to Bob's
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Propose an equal 50% split of resources between both officers' cases

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Agree to the proposed resource distribution, enabling timely family support
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Disagree with the proposal, causing delays and reducing intervention effectiveness

description: Two independent aromatherapists, Alice and Bob, are collaborating for the first time to create a limited batch of a new essential oil blend to sell at a local market. If Bob rejects the proposal, the blend is discarded, and neither participant earns any profit. Both want to maximize their share, but the success of the product depends on mutual agreement.

responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the proposed division, discarding the blend and earning no profit

Both investigators want the audit to succeed but also seek a workload division they perceive as fair and manageable. Bob can then accept the proposed time split or reject it. If Bob rejects the proposal, the joint session will be canceled, and neither researcher will present at the conference. The researchers must balance their desire for presentation time with the risk of losing the opportunity entirely.

proposer_behavior_choices.selfish_split: Propose to allocate 42 minutes (70%) to themselves and 18 minutes (30%) to Bob
proposer_behavior_choices.compromise_split: Propose to allocate 36 minutes (60%) to themselves and 24 minutes (40%) to Bob
proposer_behavior_choices.equal_split: Propose an equal split of 30 minutes each

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Accept the proposed division of the 60-minute presentation slot
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the proposal, leading to cancellation of their joint session

description: In a coral reef ecosystem, two juvenile clownfish, Alice and Bob, have discovered a limited sea anemone shelter that provides vital protection from predators. The anemone can only shelter one fish at a time, so Alice proposes a schedule dividing the 24-hour shelter availability between them. Bob then chooses to accept or reject this proposed schedule. If Bob rejects, neither fish gains access to the shelter that day, increasing their vulnerability to predators equally. Both fish depend heavily on this shelter for survival, making cooperation crucial despite their competition for exclusive use.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Propose to occupy the anemone for 19 hours and allow Bob 5 hours
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Propose to occupy the anemone for 14 hours and allow Bob 10 hours
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Propose to split the day evenly, 12 hours each

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Accept the proposed shelter time schedule
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the schedule, resulting in no shelter use for either fish today

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Propose to split the donations equally, fifty percent each

description: At a bustling community legal clinic, Alice, a seasoned volunteer, must decide how to assign the responsibilities for an urgent client case between herself and Bob, a recently joined volunteer. Alice proposes a division of the various case preparation and management tasks, taking into account the complexity and urgency of the case. Bob then evaluates the proposed distribution and decides whether to accept it or not. If Bob accepts, both volunteers proceed and the case moves forward. If Bob rejects the proposal, the clinic will have to turn down the case, resulting in lost opportunity to help the client and to gain valuable practical experience for both volunteers.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_moderate: Alice proposes to handle 60% of the case responsibilities, assigning 40% to Bob
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_balanced: Alice proposes an equal split of 50% of the responsibilities to each volunteer

responder_behavior_choices.reject: Bob rejects the proposed distribution, forcing the clinic to decline the case

Alice, who is managing the project schedule, proposes how to allocate these consulting hours between herself and Bob. Bob reviews the proposal and decides whether to accept or reject it. If Bob accepts, both earn consulting fees and performance bonuses proportional to their assigned hours. If Bob rejects the proposal, the client cancels the entire project, and neither consultant receives any fees or bonuses.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Assign 75 consulting hours to herself and 25 hours to Bob
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Assign 60 consulting hours to herself and 40 hours to Bob
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Split the consulting hours evenly: 50 hours each

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Agree to the proposed consulting hours allocation
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Decline the proposal, causing the client to cancel the project

description: Alice and Bob are lead cryptographic engineers at a fast-growing tech startup tasked with launching a new secure messaging feature. Alice must propose how to divide the project budget and responsibilities between her research team and Bob's implementation team. She presents a plan outlining the allocation of core algorithm design, protocol drafting, integration, testing, and documentation tasks along with associated funding. Bob then decides to approve or veto the proposal. Approval moves the project forward on schedule, enabling both engineers to qualify for performance bonuses tied to timely delivery and product success. A veto triggers a full project review, delaying the launch and jeopardizing their bonuses and the startup’s growth targets.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Alice proposes to allocate 80% of the budget and key research tasks (core algorithm design, proof-of-concept) to her team, offering Bob 20% for implementation support and testing.
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Alice proposes a 60/40 split: her team handles research and initial protocol drafting (60%), while Bob’s team manages integration, testing, and documentation (40%).
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Alice suggests an even 50/50 division of budget and responsibilities between her research team and Bob’s implementation/testing team.

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Bob endorses the proposal, committing his team to the agreed-upon tasks and budget, keeping the project on track.
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Bob vetoes the proposal, triggering a comprehensive project review that delays the product launch and risks their bonuses.

description: Two ukulele craftsmen, Alice and Bob, are collaborating in a shared workshop with limited access to premium wood materials. Alice has the first opportunity to propose how to divide the available premium wood between herself and Bob for their upcoming ukulele production. Bob can then decide to accept or reject Alice's proposed division. If Bob rejects the proposal, neither craftsman can use any premium wood in this production cycle, reducing the quality and value of their instruments.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Allocate eighty percent of the premium wood to herself and twenty percent to Bob
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Allocate sixty percent of the premium wood to herself and forty percent to Bob
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Allocate fifty percent of the premium wood to herself and fifty percent to Bob

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Accept the proposed division of premium wood
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the proposed division, resulting in no premium wood usage this cycle

description: Two established sports pundits, Alice and Bob, have been selected to co-host a prestigious live segment during a major sports championship. As the show producer is seeking a dynamic and engaging presentation, Alice is asked to propose how to divide the 60-minute live airtime between herself and Bob. The division will determine each pundit's on-air exposure, which directly impacts their public profile, future contract offers, and endorsement opportunities. Bob can either accept Alice's proposed division or reject it outright. If Bob rejects the proposal, the segment is canceled, resulting in a missed opportunity for both, including loss of live exposure, diminished reputation in the industry, and the forfeit of a generous appearance bonus. The negotiation thus carries significant professional and financial stakes for both participants.

participants.name: Alice
participants.profile: Sports pundit with expertise in live commentary and analysis

participants.name: Bob
participants.profile: Respected sports pundit known for insightful pre- and post-game breakdowns

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_unequal: Propose keeping 45 minutes of airtime for herself and giving Bob 15 minutes
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_moderate: Propose keeping 36 minutes for herself and giving Bob 24 minutes
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_equal: Propose splitting the 60 minutes equally: 30 minutes each

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Agree to the proposed division and confirm participation in the segment
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Decline the proposed division, leading to cancellation of the live segment and loss of all associated benefits for both parties

description: In a busy corporate office, Alice, an administrative assistant, is tasked with proposing how to allocate a fixed monthly budget for purchasing shared office supplies between herself and Bob, another assistant on the team. Alice must decide how to divide the budget to cover supplies that will primarily benefit her daily tasks and those that will primarily benefit Bob's tasks. Once Alice submits her proposal, Bob reviews the suggested allocation and chooses whether to approve it or reject it. If Bob rejects the proposal, no supplies will be ordered this month, potentially reducing both assistants’ efficiency and ability to complete their responsibilities. Both Alice and Bob’s productivity depends directly on the amount of budget allocated to their respective supplies. This scenario captures the negotiation and fairness considerations involved in shared resource allocation within a professional environment, without referencing personal relationships or explicit game theory terminology.

Both curators share the professional credit and networking opportunities equally.
reject_any_offer: Neither curator receives any recognition or career benefit, as the exhibition is canceled.
Neither curator receives any recognition or career benefit, as the exhibition is canceled.

Bob then chooses to accept the proposed allocation, allowing both to proceed with building their portions of the exhibit, or to reject it, which results in neither receiving any materials and the exhibit not being completed. The quality and impact of the final exhibit depend directly on how the materials are shared.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Keep 80% of the premium materials and allocate 20% to Bob
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Keep 60% of the premium materials and allocate 40% to Bob
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Split the premium materials evenly, 50% each

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Accept the proposed materials allocation and proceed with exhibit construction
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the proposed materials allocation, resulting in no materials for either and the exhibit not being completed

description: In a small town, Alice and Bob are members of a community gardening group that manages a shared garden space with 8 plots available each growing season. Alice proposes a plan for dividing the plots between herself and Bob, deciding how many plots each person will cultivate for their crops and community events. Bob then chooses whether to accept Alice's proposed division. If Bob rejects the proposal, the garden stays unused that season, leading to no harvest, missed community engagement opportunities, and potential reputational harm for both gardeners within the community.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Alice takes 6 plots (75%) and offers Bob 2 plots (25%)
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Alice takes 5 plots (62.5%) and offers Bob 3 plots (37.5%)
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Split the plots evenly, giving 4 plots each

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Approve Alice's proposed garden plot allocation
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the proposal, leaving the garden unused this season

description: Two account executives at a tech company, Alice and Bob, are collaborating on renewing a major client account. The client generates $100,000 in annual recurring revenue, and the company pays a one-time $10,000 retention bonus to be split between the two executives if the renewal is secured. Company policy allows the lead executive (Alice) to propose a split of the bonus, after which the supporting executive (Bob) can accept or reject the proposal. If Bob accepts, both receive the agreed-upon shares. If Bob rejects, the client senses internal disagreement, the renewal falls through, and neither executive receives any bonus. The company expects negotiations to be professional and to consider both executives' contributions to the client relationship.

proposer_behavior_choices.aggressive_split: Alice proposes keeping $7,000 of the bonus and giving Bob $3,000, citing her larger role in managing the client.
proposer_behavior_choices.compromise_split: Alice proposes keeping $5,500 and giving Bob $4,500, acknowledging both played significant roles in the renewal.
proposer_behavior_choices.even_split: Alice proposes splitting the $10,000 bonus evenly, $5,000 each, emphasizing team collaboration.

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Bob accepts Alice's proposed split, and both receive their respective shares of the bonus.
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Bob rejects the proposed split, the client is lost due to perceived internal conflict, and neither executive receives any bonus.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Allocate seventy-five percent of the speaking time to herself and twenty-five percent to Bob
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Allocate sixty percent of the speaking time to herself and forty percent to Bob

payoff_matrix_description.natural_language_description: If Alice allocates seventy-five percent of the speaking time to herself and Bob accepts, Alice gains a large share of exposure while Bob gains a smaller share. If Bob rejects, neither manager speaks, resulting in no exposure for both. Similarly, if Alice proposes a sixty-forty or fifty-fifty split and Bob accepts, the speaking time and exposure are divided accordingly. Rejection always leads to zero speaking time and lost exposure for both managers.

description: At the end of a long shift at a busy café, two baristas, Alice and Bob, are left to divide a generous tip jar. The café has no set rules for how tips are split, so the two must agree on a division before leaving for the night. Alice is designated to suggest how the tip jar should be shared between them. Bob then decides whether to accept or reject Alice’s proposed split. If Bob rejects the offer, both must leave the café without taking any tips, as the manager locks the jar away if there is any disagreement. payoff_matrix_description.natural_language: If Bob accepts Alice's proposal, the tips are split as she suggested. For example, if Alice proposes 70% for herself and 30% for Bob, and Bob accepts, Alice receives 70% and Bob 30%. If Bob rejects any proposal, neither receives any of the tips.

If the offer is rejected, the sponsorship deal is withdrawn, resulting in both clubs receiving nothing.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Propose that their own club receives seventy percent of the sponsorship fund, and the other club receives thirty percent
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Propose that their own club receives sixty percent of the sponsorship fund, and the other club receives forty percent
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Propose that both clubs receive an equal fifty percent split of the sponsorship fund

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Accept the proposed division of the sponsorship fund
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the proposed division, causing the sponsorship deal to be canceled

payoff_matrix_description.natural_language_payoff: If the responder accepts the offer, the proposer’s club receives the proposed percentage of the sponsorship fund and the responder’s club receives the complementary percentage. If rejected, neither club receives any sponsorship funding.

responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the proposed supply distribution

description: During a tough morning break at boot camp, Alice discovers a hidden stash of 10 energy bars in the storage room. Knowing that the next obstacle course starts soon and the team’s stamina is running low, she decides to propose how to share the bars with Bob. If Bob accepts, they split the energy bars as proposed, helping both maintain their energy levels. If Bob rejects, neither gets any bars, which could lead to slower pace or extra push-ups during the upcoming obstacle course, affecting their overall performance.

proposer_behavior_choices.divide_equally: Divide the energy bars equally, 5 bars each

responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the proposed distribution, so neither participant receives any energy bars

description: Dr. Alice and Dr. Bob are lead scientists at a prestigious research institute who have jointly secured a competitive grant to develop an innovative biodegradable fiber. If Bob rejects the proposal, the entire grant will be forfeited, meaning neither workshop receives new equipment, potentially limiting opportunities for both instructors and their students at the upcoming vocational fair.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Split the grant evenly, allocating $5,000 to each workshop

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Accept the proposed equipment allocation
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the allocation, forfeiting the entire grant

description: Alice, a senior remotely operated vehicle (ROV) engineer, is tasked with creating the maintenance schedule for an 8-hour dry-dock session used for vital vehicle inspections and diagnostics. She proposes how to divide this limited time between her essential calibration and safety checks and Bob's diagnostic tests. Bob, a junior ROV engineer, reviews Alice's proposed schedule and can either approve it or request changes. If Bob rejects the schedule, the dry-dock slot goes unused that week, causing delays in maintenance that raise operational risks and costs for both their teams.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Reserve 5 hours for her tasks and 3 hours for Bob's diagnostics
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Split the 8-hour slot evenly with 4 hours each

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Approve the proposed schedule
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Request a revision, causing the dry-dock slot to remain unused this week

Acceptance means both artists exhibit their works according to the agreed allocation, gaining valuable exposure and career advancement opportunities. If Bob rejects the proposal, neither artist participates in the exhibition this year, and the organizers select other candidates instead.

If Bob rejects, the harvest cannot be shared and both end up without any produce from the garden.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Propose that Alice receives seventy percent of the harvest and Bob receives thirty percent
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Propose that Alice receives sixty percent of the harvest and Bob receives forty percent
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Propose that Alice and Bob each receive fifty percent of the harvest

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Accept the proposed division of the harvest
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the proposed division, resulting in no harvest for either participant

payoff_matrix_description.natural_language: If Bob accepts the proposed harvest division, Alice and Bob receive portions corresponding to the percentages proposed, with Alice's share first and Bob's second. If Bob rejects, neither receives any harvest from the garden.

responder_behavior_choices.reject: Bob rejects the proposal, causing the organizers to withdraw the fee entirely

description: During a particularly dry season, two permaculture practitioners, Alice and Bob, must decide how to share access to a limited water source critical for sustaining their gardens. Alice writes a proposal in the soil, suggesting how to divide the water for the upcoming months. The scarcity is due to a recent drought and new upstream usage regulations, making every drop essential. Bob reviews the proposal and decides whether to accept it. If Bob rejects the proposal, neither will have access to the water, risking significant damage to their respective gardens. Alice tends a young orchard while Bob runs a small herb nursery, each with personal stakes in this decision beyond mere percentages.

payoff_matrix_description.natural_language: If Alice allocates 80% of the equipment to her region and 20% to Bob's region and Bob accepts, Alice's region benefits significantly more with eight units of agricultural productivity improvement, while Bob's region gains two units. If Bob rejects, neither region gets any equipment, resulting in zero productivity gains. Similarly, a 60-40 split yields six units for Alice's region and four for Bob's if accepted, and a 50-50 split results in equal gains of five units each. Rejection always results in no gains.

If Bob rejects the proposal, neither appraiser receives any fee from this appraisal.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Propose to keep seventy percent of the appraisal fee and allocate thirty percent to Bob
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Propose to keep fifty-five percent of the appraisal fee and allocate forty-five percent to Bob
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Propose to split the appraisal fee equally, fifty percent each

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Agree to the proposed division of the appraisal fee
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the proposed division, causing no appraisal fee to be paid to either appraiser

description: Alice and Bob are admissions counselors preparing for the busy university application season. Alice proposes how to allocate the upcoming workload, including reviewing applications and coordinating interviews. Bob must decide whether to accept Alice’s proposal. If Bob rejects it, the admissions timeline will be disrupted, causing increased overtime hours and potentially harming both of their annual performance evaluations.

proposer_behavior_choices.heavy_lift_plan: Alice proposes to take on the majority of the application reviews and interview scheduling herself, leaving Bob with fewer tasks and less opportunity for performance credit.
proposer_behavior_choices.balanced_compromise_plan: Alice suggests a somewhat uneven split, where she handles more tasks but Bob still receives a meaningful share of responsibilities and recognition.
proposer_behavior_choices.equal_partnership_plan: Alice offers to divide all application season duties and related performance credit evenly between herself and Bob.

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Bob agrees to the proposed workload division and performance credit allocation.
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Bob declines the proposal, which risks delays, increased overtime, and potential negative impacts on both their performance evaluations.

description: Alice and Bob are political participants negotiating the allocation of a shared regional development fund. Alice proposes how the total fund should be divided between their respective districts. Bob then decides whether to accept or reject Alice's proposed allocation. If Bob rejects the proposal, the funding is withheld entirely, and neither district receives any financial support.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Propose allocating seventy-five percent of the fund to Alice's district and twenty-five percent to Bob's district
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Propose allocating sixty percent of the fund to Alice's district and forty percent to Bob's district
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Propose allocating fifty percent of the fund to each district

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Agree to the proposed funding allocation
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Refuse the proposed funding allocation

responder_behavior_choices.reject: Reject the proposed split, resulting in no prize money for either participant

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Propose to split the total sale price evenly, fifty percent each

description: Alice and Bob are guitar players in a band preparing for a local concert. Alice proposes how to divide the concert's ticket revenue between them. Bob can either accept the proposed revenue split or reject it. If Bob rejects the proposal, the band decides not to perform, resulting in no revenue for either of them.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Alice proposes to keep 60% of the ticket revenue and give Bob 40%
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Alice proposes to split the ticket revenue equally, 50% each

responder_behavior_choices.reject: Bob declines the proposed revenue split, and the band cancels the concert, resulting in no revenue

description: In a joint AI programming initiative, one programmer (the Budget Coordinator) proposes how to distribute the available research funding between themselves and the other programmer (the Collaborator). The Collaborator can either agree to the proposed budget split or reject it. If the proposal is rejected, the funding is withdrawn, and both programmers receive no financial support for their projects.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Allocate seventy-five percent of the budget to themselves and twenty-five percent to the collaborator
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Allocate sixty percent of the budget to themselves and forty percent to the collaborator
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Allocate fifty percent of the budget to each programmer

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Agree to the proposed budget allocation
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Decline the proposed budget allocation, resulting in no funding for either programmer

payoff_matrix_description.natural_language: If Alice proposes to keep seventy-five percent of the budget and give twenty-five percent to Bob, and Bob accepts, Alice receives seventy-five percent of the funding while Bob receives twenty-five percent. If Bob rejects, both receive no funding. Similarly, with other proposed splits: a sixty-forty split or an equal fifty-fifty split, acceptance leads to the respective funding distribution, and rejection leads to no funding for either.

description: In a regional conservation initiative, one person (the Lead Ranger) suggests how to divide available funding and personnel between two critical patrol zones in a protected forest. The other person (the Field Officer) then decides whether to accept that distribution. If the Field Officer rejects the plan, the funding remains unallocated, patrols cannot proceed this quarter, and both roles face criticism from their supervisors and local communities.

proposer_behavior_choices.plan_strict: Assign 80% of the budget and staff to Ranger Station A and only 20% to Station B
proposer_behavior_choices.plan_balanced: Assign 60% of resources to Station A and 40% to Station B
proposer_behavior_choices.plan_equal: Split resources evenly, 50% to each station

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Approve the resource allocation plan
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Decline the plan, leaving all resources unused

Alice, as the lead artist and main point of contact with the competition organizers, must draft and submit a proposal on how to divide the prize money. Bob then reviews Alice's proposal and decides whether to accept or reject it. If Bob rejects the proposal, the prize will be given to the runners-up, and neither artist will receive any money, forcing both to find alternative funding for their future projects.

participants.profile: Lead artist and main contact with organizers

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Propose keeping 80% of the prize money and giving 20% to Bob
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Propose keeping 60% of the prize money and giving 40% to Bob
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Propose an even 50/50 split of the prize money

description: Two rival tailgate groups are vying for a single premium parking spot right next to the stadium entrance on game day. Alice, the leader of Group A, proposes how much of the available space (and prime viewing area) each group will use. Bob, leader of Group B, can accept Alice’s division or reject it. If Bob rejects, neither group gets the premium spot: both must relocate to a crowded secondary lot farther away, reducing space, comfort, and overall tailgate enjoyment for everyone involved.

proposer_behavior_choices.offer_low: Alice claims 80% of the premium spot (room for six chairs and one grill), offering Bob just 20% (room for two chairs).
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_medium: Alice takes 60% of the premium spot (room for four chairs and a small table) and offers Bob 40% (room for three chairs).
proposer_behavior_choices.offer_high: Alice splits the premium spot evenly—50% each, so each group has equal space for chairs and equipment.

responder_behavior_choices.accept: Bob accepts Alice’s division and both groups set up in the premium spot accordingly.
responder_behavior_choices.reject: Bob rejects the division; both groups must move to the secondary lot, each getting limited space and fewer amenities.
